review: Im still learning this product, but it works great for what I was wanting to do. Press a few buttons and you are instantly watching Netflix or checking out music and apps. You will love this Apple TV. I do.
author: Ryan E Langston

review: Not enough directions. Not enough explanation on how to set it up and then how to use it. Had to search for over 30 minutes online to get directions to get started.
author: Elaine Clark

review: Pros: Airplay, 1080p output, ease of use, love the remote, very slim profile, matte black looks sleekCons: expensive ($100), no entry-level productIf you have apple devices (macbook, ipad, iphone, etc.), it's a great addition to have. I previously had a Roku HD, and this blows the HD out of the water. I'm not a huge Mac guy, and I prefer Windows. But, even my Gen 1 iPad complements the Apple TV in a great way. The built-in apps that I use (watch espn and HBO go, mostly), look great. Highly recommended.
author: Dave S.

review: It's Apple TV what else is there to say? It's met my expectations and plan on buying for all TVs in the house.
author: Amy Yandle

review: Love it! And it's so simple!  Plug it in and it's ready to go, well worth the $100 bucks I paid.

review: A very clever little box, seamless setup and interface.  I've barely scratched the surface of what it can do.  I only wish Apple would make a smart TV/Receive that integrates everything and takes home entertainment out of the 90s where it seems to be stuck right now...

review: I am glad I read reviews.  It was very easy to operate once we figured out how to synch it up with our tv.  Totally worth the money.  We paid $80 on Amazon but it costs $90 @ appletv.com...
